standard_metadata.standard_description: Use variables to represent quantities in a real-world or mathematical problem, and construct simple equations and inequalities to solve problems by reasoning about the quantities.

question.content: Tyler tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\begin{align} 3(x+4)&=-18\\\\ 3x+12&=-18&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ 3x&=-30&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ x&=-10&\purple{\text{Step } 3} \end{align}$  **Find Tyler's mistake.**

options.content: Tyler did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly distributed $3$ to $x+4$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly subtracted $12$ from each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $3$ to get $x=-10$.
Tyler did not make a mistake.

question.content: Taylor tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 7(y+4.5)&=32.5\\\\ \\ 7y+4.5&=32.5&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 7y&=28&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ y&=4&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Taylor's mistake.**

options.content: Taylor did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ distributed $7$ to $y$.
This is a mistake!  $7$ should have been distributed to $y+4.5$, not just $\red y$.
Taylor made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

question.content: Bryce tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac83&=3\left(c+\dfrac53\right)\\\\ \\ \dfrac83&=3c+\dfrac53&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 1&=3c&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ \dfrac13&=c&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Bryce's mistake.**

options.content: Bryce did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ distributed $3$ to $c$.
This is a mistake!  $3$ should have been distributed to $c+\dfrac53$, not just $\red c$.
Bryce made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

question.content: Frank tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} -5&=5(d+4)\\\\ \\ -5&=5d+20&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 15&=5d&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ 3&=d&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Frank's mistake.**

options.content: Frank did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly distributed $5$ to $d+4$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ added $20$ to the left side of the equation and subtracted $20$ from the right side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  $20$ should have been subtracted from both sides of the equation.
Frank made a mistake in $\blue{\text{Step }2}$.

question.content: Sharon tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 9&=-3(e-2)\\\\ \\ 9&=-3e+6&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 15&=3e&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ 5&=e&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Sharon's mistake.**

options.content: Sharon did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly distributed $-3$ to $e-2$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ added $6$ to the left side of the equation and subtracted $6$ from the right side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  $6$ should have been subtracted from both sides of the equation.
Sharon made a mistake in $\blue{\text{Step }2}$.

question.content: Vanessa tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} -12&=4(f-6)\\\\ \\ -12&=4f-24&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 12&=4f&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ 4&=f&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Vanessa's mistake.**

options.content: Vanessa did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly distributed $4$ to $f-6$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly added $24$ to each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ simplified from $12=4f$ to $4=f$.
This is a mistake!  $12=4f$ simplifies to $3=f$, not $\red{4=f}$.
Vanessa made a mistake in $\purple{\text{Step }3}$.

question.content: Timothy tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 9\left(2x+\dfrac13\right)&=39\\\\ \\ 18x+3&=39&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 18x&=36&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ x&=2&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Timothy's mistake.**

options.content: Timothy did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly distributed $9$ to $2x+\dfrac13$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly subtracted $3$ from each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $18$ to get $x=2$.
Timothy did not make a mistake.

question.content: Betsie tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 3(a+7)&=-33\\\\ \\ a+7&=-11&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ a&=-4&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Betsie's mistake.**

options.content: Betsie did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $3$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ added $7$ to the right side of the equation and subtracted $7$ from the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  $7$ should have been subtracted from both sides of the equation.
Betsie made a mistake in $\blue{\text{Step }2}$.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Chase tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac13(g-3)&=3\\\\ \\ g-3&=9&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ g&=12&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Chase's mistake.**

options.content: Chase did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $\dfrac13$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly simplified from $g-3=9$ to $g=12$.
Chase did not make a mistake.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Felix tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 2(5g-1)&=3\\\\ \\ 5g-1&=1.5&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 5g&=2.5&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ g&=0.5&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Felix's mistake.**

options.content: Felix did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $2$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly added $1$ to each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $5$ to get $g=0.5$.
Felix did not make a mistake.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Nigel tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac12(2h-4)&=20\\\\ \\ 2h-4&=10&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 2h&=14&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ h&=7&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Nigel's mistake.**

options.content: Nigel did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $\dfrac12$ and divided by $\dfrac12$ on the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $\dfrac12$ .
Nigel made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Carly tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} -4(7j+2)&=10\\\\ \\ 7j+2&=-40&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 7j&=-42&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ j&=-6&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Carly's mistake.**

options.content: Carly did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $4$ and divided by $4$ on the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $4$ .
Carly made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Gabi tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 0.1(0.5m+6)&=2\\\\ \\ 0.5m+6&=20&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ 0.5m&=14&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \\ m&=7&\purple{\text{Step } 3}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Gabi's mistake.**

options.content: Gabi did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $0.1$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly subtracted $6$ from each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $0.5$ and divided the left side of the equation by $0.5$.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $0.5$ .
Gabi made a mistake in $\purple{\text{Step }3}$.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Olga tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\begin{align} \dfrac14\left(\dfrac13k+9\right)&=6 \\\\ \dfrac13k+9&=24&\green{\text{Step } 1} \\\\ \dfrac13k&=15&\blue{\text{Step } 2} \\\\ k&=5&\purple{\text{Step } 3} \end{align}$  **Find Olga's mistake.**

options.content: Olga did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $\dfrac14$.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly subtracted $9$ from each side of the equation.
$\purple{\text{Step }3}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $\dfrac13$ and divided the left side of the equation by $\dfrac13$.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $\dfrac13$ .
Olga made a mistake in $\purple{\text{Step }3}$.

item.problemType: a(x+b) = c with divide by a

question.content: Jessie tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\begin{align} 1.5b+9&=11\\\\ 1.5b&=3&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ b&=2&\blue{\text{Step } 2} \end{align}$  **Find Jessie's mistake.**

options.content: Jessie did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ subtracted $9$ from the left side of the equation and subtracted $8$ from the right side.
This is a mistake!  $9$ should have been subtracted from both sides of the equation.
Jessie made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

question.content: Jamie tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac25n+7&=12\\\\ \\ \dfrac25n&=5&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ n&=2&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Jamie's mistake.**

options.content: Jamie did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly subtracted $7$ from each side of the equation.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $\dfrac25$ and divided by $\dfrac25$ on the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $\dfrac25$.
Jamie made a mistake in $\blue{\text{Step }2}$.

question.content: Vlad tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} -8p+14&=42\\\\ \\ -8p&=28&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ p&=-3.5&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Vlad's mistake.**

options.content: Vlad did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly subtracted $14$ from each side of the equation.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $-8$.
Vlad did not make a mistake.

question.content: Ling tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} -2q+11&=-32\\\\ \\ -2q&=-43&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ q&=21.5&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Ling's mistake.**

options.content: Ling did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly subtracted $11$ from each side of the equation.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ correctly divided each side of the equation by $-2$.
Ling did not make a mistake.

question.content: Yusuf tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac14r+2&=10\\\\ \\ \dfrac14r&=12&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ r&=48&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Yusuf's mistake.**

options.content: Yusuf did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ added $2$ to the right side of the equation and subtracted $2$ from the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  $2$ should have been subtracted from both sides of the equation.
Yusuf made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

question.content: Mia tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} 0.1t-3&=5\\\\ \\ 0.1t&=2&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ t&=20&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Mia's mistake.**

options.content: Mia did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ added $3$ to the left side of the equation and subtracted $3$ from the right side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  $3$ should have been added to both sides of the equation.
Mia made a mistake in $\green{\text{Step }1}$.

question.content: Leon tried to solve an equation step by step.  $\qquad\begin{align} \dfrac12w-12&=18\\\\ \\ \dfrac12w&=30&\green{\text{Step } 1}\\\\ \\ w&=15&\blue{\text{Step } 2}\\\\ \end{align}$  **Find Leon's mistake.**

options.content: Leon did not make a mistake.

hints.content: $\green{\text{Step }1}$ correctly added $12$ to each side of the equation.
$\blue{\text{Step }2}$ multiplied the right side of the equation by $\dfrac12$ and divided by $\dfrac12$ on the left side of the equation.
This is a mistake!  Both sides of the equation should have been divided by $\dfrac12$.
Leon made a mistake in $\blue{\text{Step }2}$.
